gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Class SurfaceElementFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.SurfaceElementFactory

  • public class SurfaceElementFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory class to create textual units, from character offsets or a list of smaller textual units. This class currently does not allow overlapping textual units; in other words, a sentence is a contiguous list of textual units. However, it allows associating multiple overlapping or non-overlapping semantic items with a single textual unit. For example, the textual unit leg pain can have semantic items for leg, pain, and leg pain associated with it.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

        public SurfaceElementFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • createSurfaceElementIfNecessary

        public SurfaceElement createSurfaceElementIfNecessary(Sentence sentence,
                                                      SpanList sp,
                                                      SpanList headSpan)
        Instantiates a new SurfaceElement from a span in a sentence, if necessary.

        The span is expected to belong to the sentence.

        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence to which the textual unit will belong to
        sp - the span of the textual unit
        headSpan - the span of the head of the textual unit
        Returns:
        a new textual unit, or null if the span does not belong to the sentence or either of them is invalid
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the sentence or span is null.

      • createSurfaceElementIfNecessary

        public SurfaceElement createSurfaceElementIfNecessary(Sentence sentence,
                                                      SpanList sp)
        Similar to createSurfaceElementIfNecessary(Sentence, SpanList, SpanList), but computes the head as well.
        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence to which the textual unit will belong to
        sp - the span of the textual unit
        Returns:
        a new textual unit, or null if the span does not belong to the sentence or either of them is invalid
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the sentence or span is null.

      • createSurfaceElementIfNecessary

        public SurfaceElement createSurfaceElementIfNecessary(Document doc,
                                                      SpanList sp,
                                                      SpanList headSpan,
                                                      boolean gapped)
        Similar to createSurfaceElementIfNecessary(Sentence, SpanList, SpanList), but allows specifying gapping.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document with the textual unit
        sp - the character offset list of the textual unit
        headSpan - the character offset list of the head of the textual unit
        gapped - whether gaps are allowed in the textual unit
        Returns:
        a new textual unit, or null if one cannot be instantiated with the given input
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the document or span is null.

      • createSurfaceElementIfNecessary

        public SurfaceElement createSurfaceElementIfNecessary(Document doc,
                                                      SpanList sp,
                                                      boolean gapped)
        Same as createSurfaceElementIfNecessary(Document, SpanList, SpanList, boolean), except it computes the head as well.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document with the textual unit
        sp - the character offset list of the textual unit
        gapped - whether gaps are allowed in the textual unit
        Returns:
        a new textual unit, or null if one cannot be instantiated with the given input
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the document or span is null.
